result.execSummary:
The defendant Meng Xiong 11661-0990 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Complete any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber if meets jail criteria for work, school, or treatment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any outstanding fees to be paid as a conditions of ES. 

Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol.  However, defendant may take valid prescriptions and only take as prescribed.  
Complete AODA assessment with follow through.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 11:02 am 
INCLUDES 16CF656 AND 14CF909. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig in person; Deft appears by phone from Leavenworth Prison, pro se. 
Date and time set for hrg in response to deft's letter requesting probation be revoked. 
State notes contact with probation agent and notes dept will not be addressing revocation until deft is available (in this case, after serving Federal time). 
COURT questions deft re: authority to act in this case. 
Deft requests time run concurrent and notes Federal Judge ordered time to run concurrent. 
Deft states he wants to participate in Drug Treatment but is unable to do so due to probation holds. 
COURT notes deft may need to file speedy detainer. 
COURT directs deft to write letter to the court requesting public defender representation. 
Adj: 11:09 am
from Defendant requesting termination of public defender- stj

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 1:25pm
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

Parties state recommendation for sentencing
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g): 7 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 4 years ES, concurrent to probation sentence in 16CF656. Credit granted for 304 days served. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. Any outstanding fees to be paid as condition of extended supervision. CONDITIONS of ES: Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. However, deft may take valid prescription and only take as prescribed. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. 

Deft is remanded to Marathon County Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Prison
Adj: 1:30pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Lou Ann Bohn
Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Case Called: 8:37am
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.

State moved to revoke DEOJ in October 2015 and will proceed to sentencing of probation
Atty O'Neill in agreement with states recommendaton

COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation. Serve 30 days MCJ, with huber if meets jail criteria for work, school, or treatment. Pay back restitution of $200 to Marathon County Sheriff's Dept. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Zero days credit given.

Case Called: 3:09pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears by Atty Suzanne O'Neill. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. PLEA: GUILTY - ct 1(manuf/deliver amp (<3g). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def deferred.  Statements by State & Defense.  COURT ORDERS: DEOJ 2 yrs. Crt adopts & signs Deferred Entry Agreement. DATES: Review Hearing - 4/12/17 @ 1:10pm BR 1. Adjourned: 3:26pm.
